The trisikad transportation that she previously funded through Kiva partner and NWTF continues to provide for Elvira and her family and is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 46 years old and married. She has seven children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Julieta has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling Natasha and MSE brand products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Marilyn has been in this business for six years. Marilyn earns additional income from electronic re-loading (prepaid mobile phone cards). 

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is 45 years old and married and has seven children. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. 

Sitti Hawa has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. 

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 13 years. She describes herself as a jovial, understanding and quiet woman. 

Previously, Josephine was running a retail shop and water business. She is employed in a kindergarten school, with which she increases her business income.

She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at her homestead and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as few customers to sell cereals to. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals for selling to her customers. Her business goal is to start a new business of running a school in her home area within five years.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 30 years old and married with two children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Marissa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making sweaters for the past 10 years. She is in much demand and highly valued among her clients. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She has gradually improved her business through the support of business loans. According to Salma, "Kashf is playing a great role by helping her. " 

She requires a loan of amount of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy good quality wool in different colors to increase her sales. It will attract more customers and improve sales, which will lead to higher profits. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy good quality wool in different colors to increase her sales.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 50 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. 

Iluminada has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending. 

Iluminada aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is a 36-year-old driver who lives with his family in the outer ger (tent) district, without basic infrastructure, of Ulaabaatar city, Mongolia. His spouse works in a local bakery and all three of their children attend secondary school. Previously, his family was living in a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Now the family lives in a new small house, which they built. In Mongolia, the winter is very cold, and he needs to install a heating system in his house. So he is requesting a 3,900,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase support materials for setting up the heating system.

loans.use: to set up heating system at his home.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin grew up in a low-income family and her parents tried hard to provide her a good education. She thanks them because she is currently employed in a local company where she can earn a decent income to satisfy her family’s needs. She has been in this occupation for one year. 

Chin is 27 years of age and married with a young child attending primary school. Chin learned from her parents how to bring up children and she also wants to offer a further education to her child, so that he can become professional someday.

In order to increase her household income, she is investing her capital in raising animals, especially cows. As a result, she is taking a loan from HKL and Kiva in the sum of 900 USD to purchase cows for fattening. Chin hopes that she can earn a good profit from this business in the future. She is very grateful for support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Baasakhuu is 39 years old, has two sons and lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She is a seller at a local food shop while her spouse works as repairer. During the summertime, she and her spouse are required to pay her elder son’s tuition fee, but unfortunately her father-in-law had medical problems, so she gave her money for her father-in-law’s treatment fees. 

For this reason she couldn’t pay her son’s tuition fee, thus she requests a Kiva loan to pay her son’s fee.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10. He describes himself to be a soft-spoken, entertaining and jovial man . He operates a motorcycle transportation service business. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located along a busy road near a market and his primary customers are local residents who go to the market daily. He describes his biggest business challenge to be increasing security problems within the area. He is unable to get customers because they fear the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a taxi to increase the transportation services within five years. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира очень завидовала раньше женщинам, которые занимаются бизнесом и предпринимательством. Ей 27 лет и она не замужем. Нодира живет с родителями и братом, у них очень дружная и счастливая семья. Она постепенно изучив рынок, спрос и потребности населения уже четвертый год занимается куплей продажей продовольственных товаров как конфеты, печения, консервы, хлеб и булочные изделия, колбасные изделия и другое. Ее брат помогает ей в бизнесе. У нее много клиентов и к каждому из них подход особый. Сейчас она стала более уверенной в себе и хорошо знает спрос населения. Нодира запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони. Она хочет использовать полученный кредит для расширения ассортимента товара. Нодира ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nodira has previously been very envious of women who were engaged in business and entrepreneurship. She is 27 years old and unmarried. Nodira lives with her parents and brother and they have a very tight-knit and happy family. She has been gradually studying the market, demand and consumption. She is already in her fourth year of buying and selling food products such as candy, cookies, preserves, bread, rolls, and sausage products, among other things. Her brother helps her with the business. She has a lot of clients and each one of them likes something different. Now she has become more confident in herself and knows the consumer demand well. Nodira is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni. She wants to use the received loan to replenish her stock of funds. Nodira awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy food items for widening her assortment

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is a 28-year-old entrepreneur at the biggest outdoor market of Mongolia. He sells sunglasses during the summer or warm time and sells leather gloves during the winter or cold season. He has two daughters and his elder daughter attends local kindergarten. His spouse helps to him to operate his business while her mother babysits their 1-year-old baby girl. 

Now it’s the beginning of the new school year, so his sunglasses business is very popular during this autumn time. He wants to increase his income. His aim in 2013 is to build a house for his family which now lives in a Mongolian felt yurt.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sunglasses to sell.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is from Kaloleni and is keen to get ahead with his family. He learned how to work as a salesman when he was very young. He took the initiative of opening his own business selling firewood from his home.
Thank God his decision was a very good one since he makes his living from his business. He works every day from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He sells either for cash or on credit because he is a very well-known person and does not take many risks as he may lose his capital and the income from his sales. Dennis is asking for a loan to buy more stock of firewood for sale.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Darkashan

texts.en:
Ms Darkashan is 39 years old, and is an energetic, married woman. She took the initiative to set-up a general store business two years ago. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to cover their day-to-day expenditures. She is striving hard to achieve her goals through her business. She offers various items in her store including bread, eggs, butter, milk, cold drinks, shampoo, cleaning products etc.

She has four daughters and one son. She is responsible for arranging their every day expenditures including food, clothing and education. She has enhanced her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Now she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional items including rice, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets. She then will then be able to manage increasing demand efficiently. She intends to utilize the earned profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items including rice, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 43 years old and living in the town of Kakata, is married and has five children ranging in age from 6 to 23, all in school and living at home. For the past 10 years, Mamie has been selling palm oil in the local market, one of her main challenges being the high prices of palm oil. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to sell, and hopes to build her house and attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Rakho

texts.en:
Rakho is a 52-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and two sons in the remote area of Punjab, Pakistan. Since 1999 her husband has run a tire shop and wants to purchase more tire material like rims, tires and wheel cups for his shop, so he can increase his sales and offer more variety to his customers. 

Her elder son is helping his father in his shop, while the younger son is studying. Rakho has requested a loan from KIVA Partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband and son in purchasing materials for their shop. She is very hopeful that the loan will bring a positive change to their lives. She will send her elder son abroad for higher education, if her husband can increase their savings and profits.

loans.use: to purchase tire material for her husband's tire shop.

loans.name: Jumah

texts.en:
Jumah is 41 years old and lives in Kakata town. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have six children between the ages of 12 and 25. Only two of her children live with her and attend school. 

For the past eight years she has been selling rice and soap. Sometimes she makes less profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and soap for her business. In the near future she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice and soap for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Ely

texts.en:
Ma. Ely is an active member of PMPC.  She is 55 years old, married, with five adult children. She has been engaged in selling ready-to-wear clothes and used clothes for a period of six years with a monthly average income of PHP 3,000. 

She has taken another loan from PMPC to purchase ready-to-wear and used clothes stocks for sale. She plans to used the profit to save and invest more capital in the business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear and used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 35 years old, a married woman and a mother of two sons and two daughters. She is living in a remote area of Punjab, Pakistan. Her husband, who is an auto mechanic by profession, is the only person earning money in the family but his income is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of his family. Therefore to contribute and to support her husband, Sajida wants to generate some income by sewing clothes. She already has an excellent experience of doing this for a year.  

Sajida, as a member of three-person lending group, has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to start her business. With the profit she will provide her children a quality education and fulfill their other needs. Currently she is living in a rented house with her family, so her biggest aim in life is to build her own house and live happily with her family in the future. 

Note: In the picture Sajida is holding a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine to start a tailoring business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 61 years old, married, and raising one child who is in school. However, she has four other adult children. In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business, rearing pigs. Thanks to Grace's persistence and hard work, having started with one pig, she has been able to develop her business and now has several pigs. She also sells liquid detergents in plastic bottles door-to-door. Her husband helps her with the business in his free time. 

In order to further develop her business, Grace requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES from Yehu to invest in her business by purchasing another pig and feeds as well as renovating the pig pen. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business in order to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase another pig and feeds as well as renovating the pig pen.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth needs another loan. This one will help her to pay workers to mulch her banana plantation. She has been an ardent borrower of Hofokam and repays her loans promptly. Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent home and buying a car. She is facing the hardships of price fluctuations and inflation, high transportation costs and inadequate capital to buy adequate farming equipment. She has a vision of expanding her farming activities to new areas, hiring employees to help expand her business and buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay workers who are mulching her banana plantation.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Badamtsetseg is a 45-year-old inspector and lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her spouse is a public transport driver, while her son attends a local university. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to pay her son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Rochelle Dorothy

texts.en:
Rochelle Dorothy is a micro-finance member of PMPC. She is 31 years old and married with two children, a student and an infant. She has made snacks for sale for five years, earning a monthly average of Php 2,000, while her husband's livelihood is fishing.  

She took a loan from PMPC to purchase fishing gear for her husband's fishing activity. She wants to use the income to save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru:
Анаркул 60 лет, вдова, воспитала 7 детей. Анаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется корова с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2,60 га земли с фасолью и картофелем,  ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Анаркул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки земельного участка.
texts.en:
Anarkul is a 60-year-old widow who has raised 7 children. For the past 20 years, she has been farming and breeding livestock as the main source of income for her family, having started this business with a sum of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Anarkul's farm presently includes a cow with offspring, 10 goats and sheep, as well as 2.60 hectares of land with beans and potatoes. The business' monthly income amounts to roughly 6,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Anarkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into her business by purchasing a parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta is 35 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and stopped her education at grade six. She has four children between the ages of 20 to 9 years old and all of them attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 40-year-old married women who lives with her husband and a daughter in Punjab, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For 25 years, Yasmeen's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired.

Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: to repair the engine of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is from the village of Giorgitsminda, Kakheti region. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband, Vasil. Vasil works as a watchman and gets a monthly salary. Dariko runs the dairy business. In particular, she has two milk cows and a calf. She milks the cows every day and produces different kinds of dairy products, which are sold locally. In addition, the family owns a plot of land, where maize is grown. Besides her agricultural business, Dariko works as a cleaner at a petrol station to earn additional income. She is a very hard-working woman, with a great experience in her work.

Dariko requested a loan to build a barn for the maize. She will purchase building materials with this credit. After the barn will be built, she will be able to sow more maize and keep it in her barn. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income Dariko plans to repair her house, which is old and damaged. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a barn for the maize.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 40 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has three children between the ages of eight and 25 all of whom attend school. For the past two years she has been operating a shop where she sells soft drinks, rice, oil, soap and other goods. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, soft drinks, rice, soap and other items to expand her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, soft drinks, rice, soap and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is from Sagarejo district, East Georgia. She is 54 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Makvala’s husband works as a plumber and her son as a security guard. They get a monthly income. The family runs the agricultural business. In particular, they own a vineyard and produce wine. Makvala is involved in a dairy business as well. She has a milk cow and produces cheese. She sells the cheese to a cheese retailer. Makvala is very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

She requested a loan to purchase three calves. She will raise them and sell them for a good price. Makvala hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 26 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have two children aged two and nine who live at home. For the past six years Yasah has been operating a little shop where she sells used clothes. She started this business with 1,500 Liberian dollars. She enjoys her business because she makes more profits and has lot of customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de once y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz,arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos fuera de las plagas. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio y poderse comprar una moto.
Le gusta bailar y compartir momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages eleven and seven, in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The group performs seasonal farm work such as planting corn, rice, and beans. 

María grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market. María is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and will buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and supplies to protect her crops from pests and keep them in good condition.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to increase her business so that she can buy a motorcycle. María Elena enjoys dancing and sharing pleasant moments with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and supplies to keep her crops in good condition.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fauzia is a 32-year-old hardworking woman, who is working in a medical store as a sales woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her three daughters and a son. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is not enough to provide a quality education for the children. 

Therefore Fauzia is planning to open a new garment shop near her house as well. And for this she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use this loan for purchasing clothes and some other related material for the garment shop. 

Fauzia and her family are hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will increase their net savings and income. 

Note: In the picture Fauzia is holding her pass book and her daughter Hadia.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for opening a new garment shop.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her son in a small house which located in the outer 'ger' district (with traditional felt dwellings) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her son attends a local institute in his 4th year, so he has only one year to finish his institute. 

Dolgor is requesting a 1,200,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to pay her son’s tuition fees.  Her son’s major is electrical engineering and she believes that her son will be very qualified and a much needed person in his country.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Jackie Lou

texts.en: Jackie Lou is 20 years old and married with one infant child. She lives in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She has had a sari-sari store business (selling a variety of grocery products) for over a year, earning a monthly average of Php 2,500.  She took out a loan with PMPC to purchase additional grocery stock for sale.  She plans to use the profit to save in preparation for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase addtional groceries for sale

loans.name: Josefa Johanna

texts.es:
Josefa Johanna tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de doce, diez y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Josefa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, urea y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca para poder aumentar el negocio y tener mayores utilidades. Le gusta practicar el en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Josefa Johanna, 28, lives with her common-law husband and three children, ages 12, 10, and 1, in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The communal bank members are seasonal farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Josefa grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market. Josefa is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans, and will buy seeds, urea, compost, supplies, and liquid fertilizers to keep the crops in good condition. With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a farm so that she can increase her business and have more profits. Josefa enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu lives in Kakata  town; she is 49 years old and has four children between the ages of 15 and 21  that are in school and live at home. For the past fourteen years Lorpu has been selling dry goods such as palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice. She started this business by selling cold water. One thing she enjoys is that she is always  busy and her business is going fast. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice  for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice  for her business

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms. Kaneez is 28-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping the family by working as a female tailor while her husband is a waiter in a restaurant. She is been in the business of stitching in her area for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching and beautifully designs bedcovers and pillows. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

Kaneez earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, zips, buttons. etc. to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: To buy a stock of thread in different colors, zips, buttons, etc. to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Flordelona

texts.en: Flordelona is an active member of PMPC. She is 44 years old, married, and a resident of Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She has engaged in a sari-sari store, or general store, business for over three years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,500. She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 13,000 to purchase grocery stock to sell. She plans to use the profit to save and invest more capital in the business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, a 32-year-old resident of the town of Kakata, is married to a bus driver, and they have three children ranging in age from 11 months to 19 years, all living at home.

For the past 18 years Mamie has been selling palm oil in the local market, sometimes having to buy her product at a very high price and thus realizing a very low profit. Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business, and in the future plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Susana Eufemia

texts.es:
Susana Eufemia tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de seis y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Susana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa y tierra para poder aumentar el negocio.

Le gusta bailar y el deporte en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Susana Eufernia is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages six and one, in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the communal bank UNIDO SOMOS MAS (United We Are More) is located in the El Marañón disctrict, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This small bank is devoted to short-cycle farming and the sowing of corn, rice, and beans.

Susana works in farming, sowing corn, rice, and beans. She buys her materials at the Agro Karlita commercial center and sells her products in the Castillo commercial center.

She is asking for a loan in order to sow corn, rice, and beans; to buy seeds, supplies, manure, and fertilizer for her crops.

With the support of the loan it would help her financially to fulfill her needs, and to face challenges such as plagues, disease, and changes in climate. Her dream is to be able to buy a house for herself and land to be able to increase her business.

She likes dancing and sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Alicia Yisenia

texts.es:
Alicia Yisenia tiene 36 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de catorce,  trece y ocho años de edad en el  Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Alicia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder agrandar la casa que tiene  para poder vivir  mejor y cómoda con la familia .En su  tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música mientras se ocupa de los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Alicia Yisenia, 36, lives with her common-law husband and three children, ages 14, 13, and 8, in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the communal bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The communal bank members are seasonal farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Alicia grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market. She is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and will buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops. 

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to expand her house so that she and her family can live better and more comfortably. In her free time, Alicia enjoys listening to music as she does the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Monica Narcisa

texts.es:
Mónica Narcisa tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre con el esposo y con los tres hijos de doce, nueve, un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Mónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Kar ita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse maquinaria para poder tratar y trabajar el terreno. En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Mónica Narcisa, 33, lives with her common-law husband and their three children, ages 12, 9, and 1, in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of the communal bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The communal bank members are seasonal farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Mónica grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market. She is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and will buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. The challenges she faces include pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy machinery so that she can treat and work the land. In her free time, Mónica enjoys doing household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 44, resides with her husband and five children at Kakata, Liberia. Her children are between the ages of 9 and 28 and are attending school. She sells rubber bowls, plates, spoons, and buckets in the market. She has been involved in this business for the past 10 years. She learned to sell from her parents. She is proud of her business, because with the profit generated from the business she can buy more goods and help her husband with the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber bowls, plates, spoons, and buckets for the business. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber bowls, plates, spoons, and buckets for the business.

loans.name: Famats

texts.en: Famats is 26 years old and lives in Kakata town; she is married and has five children ages between 1 and 12 who live at home. Only three of them are in school. For the past three  years she has been selling candy, biscuits, cookies and other items. She started this business with loan from her friend. She enjoys her business because she meets new people every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy, biscuits, cookies and other items for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase candy, biscuits, cookies and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Michael  Ndungu

texts.en: Michael is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.  He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living.  He operates his business in a competitive environment with reliable customers, and employs one person.  Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save and been trained in financial management.  He dreams of buying a pickup in the future.  Michael is requesting 100,000 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 38-year-old widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 to 18 years. She describes herself to be a determined and diligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are the general public within the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of clothes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for her business. Her business goal is to increase her sales and buy 20 bales of clothes weekly within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children and cater for their diet, as she is the sole provider for them.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en: Mutua is 47 years old and married with four children who are in school. He does livestock farming to earn a living. He also does crop farming to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming a large-scale farmer in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a hardworking 20-year-old businesswoman and mother of two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She operates her business in a busy environment with loyal customers. She has engaged in this business for two years and has employed two people. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 100,000 to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kaloleni. She is single and lives in her own house. She has been in business for two years. She started her business with her own funds, intending to improve her income and to assist her parents. She operates a vegetable stall that is located along one of the busy streets of the town.

Salome's purpose and goal is to see herself prosper in life. The loan will be used to invest in her business in order to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, etc. This way she will continue to provide for her customers even as she moves forward.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, etc.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise est une jeune femme de 34 ans mariée, mère d'enfants. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 14 ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail et elle a aussi besoin d'un deuxième casque pour être plus rapide dans l’accomplissement de ses taches. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter un deuxième casque,  les greffes et huiles de cheveux en gros. Ceci lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Elise is 34-year-old young woman who is married with children. After her training, she opened a salon that she has been running for the past 14 years. She often faces a shortage of cosmetics and hair extensions in her shop because she purchases her products at retail. She is also in need of a second hooded hair dryer so that she can serve her customers more quickly. Her goal is to provide satisfactory service to her customers which will so that she is able to earn a large income. 

Elise is requesting a loan to purchase a second hooded hair dryer, and to buy hair extensions and hair oils wholesale. This will permit her to reach her goals. The income generated from this loan will help to Elise to satisfy her needs, as well as those of her family. It will also allow her to save money, which she will use to help grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second hooded hair dryer, and to buy hair extensions and hair oils wholesale

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms. Uzma is a 30-year-old, married woman.  She is a motivated mother who is helping her family by making polyester and cotton, which are commonly used in quilts, pillows and outerwear.  She knows the techniques very well.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.  Her husband is employed as a sales person in a garment shop, and earns insufficient wages to meet household expenditures alone.  

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stocks of nylon and cotton from the market at lower rates to meet the increasing demand.  In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenues to build a separate room for her children.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy nylon and cotton from the market for her business.

loans.name: Muhtorjon

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Мухторчон и его семья очень старый и не имеет нормального удобства для жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 44 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но их доход от скотоводства не достаточно для этого. Он должен заменить двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная, а также сделать фасадную штукатурку. Мухторчон запрашивает кредит на сумму  4750 сомони для покупки строительных материалов и дверей для ремонта дома. Мухторчон и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: The house where Muhtorjon lives with his family is very old and does not offer basic comfort, which is why Muhtorjon must do repairs urgently. Muhtorjon is 44 years old, married and bringing up four children. The children have been asking their parents to make house repairs, but the family income from animal husbandry is insufficient. Muhtorjon needs to replace the doors since they do not provide enough heat insulation in winter, and winters in Tajikistan can be quite cold. He also needs to plaster the house facade. Muhtorjon is requesting a loan in the amount of 4750 TJS to buy construction materials and doors in order to repair his house. Muhtorjon and his children are looking forward to the lenders’ kind help in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy doors and cement for  house repairs.

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en:
Ms. Sabran is a 51-year-old, active, married woman.  She has been in the business of making red chili powder for eighteen years, and has previously received funds through Kashf Foundation.  She buys red chilies in bulk from the city and sells them in powder form in her town, where it is commonly used in food for taste.  She happily does it for the sake of her family.

Ms. Sabran is the mother of seven children.  She lives in a large, conventional family home with her husband, children and other relatives.  Her husband is employed in a small general store as a sales person.  She must earn more to cover the everyday expenditures of her family.  To continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of Rs.30,000/-.  She will use the loan to buy a large quantity of red chilies to increase the amount of product she provides.  She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business.  She intends to use the profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy red chilies to make chili powder.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms Uzma is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She successfully runs a business of stitching at her home. Her husband is a driver and earns insufficient income to support his family. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has gradually improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000/- to purchase a stock of threads, buttons, zippers, laces, etc. to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving good quality food to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of threads, buttons, zippers, laces, etc.

loans.name: James  Chege

texts.en: James is 37 years old and married with three children who are in school. He sells beauty cosmetics to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years. Besides, he does dairy farming to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Rosaura Cristina

texts.es:
Rosaura Cristina tiene 32 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y sus dos hijos de once y nueve años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.
Rosaura se dedica a la agricultura a la 
siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Rosaura Cristina, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 9, in the Pueblo Viejo canton in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. The UNIDO SOMOS [We Are United] communal bank is in El Marañón, Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton. The communal bank members are seasonal farmers who grow corn, rice and beans. Rosaura grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at the Castillo center. 

She is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies, and fertilizers for the crops. The loan will give Rosaura financial help to meet these needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan because she will be able to buy the supplies. 

Rosaura's dream is to buy farmland and produce much more. She likes to play sports in her free time.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. He does livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. Besides, he does crop farming to generate more income. Kyalo dreams of growing his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a cow and a goat.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a goat.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms  Nusrat is a 47-year-old woman who has been in the business of stitching for the last fifteen years. She initiated her business when Kashf Foundation started its operations in her town in 2007. She was approached by a Kashf Foundation business development officer and she decided to take out a small loan in order to fast track her business growth. This played a fundamental role in her business growth as she had no access to capital before. 

She is motivated to provide her family with the basic requirements of life. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to be employed. She needs to improve her business to get more return, so she requested a loan of Rs. 25000/- to buy  threads, buttons and zippers of different colors in large quantities to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of growing her business in the future and aspires to save enough money to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads, buttons and zippers of different colors in large quantities to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Jeniffer  Kisio

texts.en: Jeniffer is 37 years old and married with five children who are in school. She sells ropes to earn a living. She operates her business in a good environment and has employed one person. She has been engaged in this business for two years.  Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, Jeniffer dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy ropes to sell.

loans.use: To buy ropes to sell.

loans.name: Belgica Raquel

texts.es:
Bélgica Raquel tiene 35 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de diecisiete y quince años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Bélgica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Bélgica Raquel, 35,  is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 15, in Pueblo Viejo canton. The UNIDO SOMOS [We Are United] communal bank is in El Marañón in Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton. The communal bank members are seasonal farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans. Bélgica plants corn, rice and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at the Castillo center. 

She is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies, and fertilizers for the crops. The loan will provide Rosaura with financial help to meet her needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan because she will be able to buy her supplies. Her dream is to buy a farm. She likes to play sports in her free time.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies, and organic and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.fr: Alfred est un homme de 46 ans,célibataire,père d'un enfant de 8 ans qui va à l'école.Il a ouvert et gère un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 13 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne normalement grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son expérience qui lui ont permis de conquérir une clientèle importante.Mais cependant,la croissance considérable de sa clientèle ne lui permet guère de satisfaire à la demande de celle-ci,ceci dû à la petitesse de son capital d'où l'importance de ce crédit en moment pour son activité,car il l'aidera à augmenter le nombre de casiers de boissons ce qui lui permetrra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle ,mais d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices.il réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alfred is the 46-year-old single father of an eight-year-old child who attends school. He opened his own bar 13 years ago, and continues to run it in a quarter of the capitol. His business functions well due to Alfred's warm manner and his experience, both of which have enabled him to gain a large clientele. 

However, the significant growth of his customer base means that it has become difficult for him to meet demand. This is due to a lack of capital, which has lead to his request for a loan. This loan will allow Alfred to increase the number of cases of bottled drinks he keeps in stock, which will help him not only to satisfy the demand of his customers but also to increase his sales and income. He will reinvest a portion of his income into his business, and the rest he will use to meet the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his supply of cases of bottled drinks

loans.name: Jessica Jacinta

texts.es:
JESSICA JACINTA tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil divorsiada tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 15 años de edad, vive con los padres y el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

JESSICA JACINTA se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata maleza.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá tener mejores ingresos.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las plagas y la lancha. El sueño es salir de viaje. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasiar con la familia.
texts.en:
Jessica Jacinta, 40, is divorced and has two children, ages 19 and 15. She lives with her parents and son in Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She is a member of the communal bank BRUNIQUILDE, located in Calabi in Ventanas canton. She is a farmer who plants corn and rice. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, urea, fertilizer, and weed killer. 

She purchases supplies in Ventanas every two weeks. The loan will help her increase her income. She faces challenges such as pests and other infestations. Her dream is to travel, and she likes to be with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, urea, fertilizer, and weed killer.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina esta casada, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene un hijo que aun no estudia,se dedica a la confección de tejidos, inicio este trabajo con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar una maquina cerradora y materiales necesarios, para seguir confeccionando mas camisa y mochilas, y así mejorar sus ganancias. Espera en el futuro contar con trabajadores y mas clientes.
texts.en:
María Cristina, 22, is married and completed third grade in elementary school.  She has a son who does not attend school yet.  She works sewing textiles.  She started with little capital and to date has three years’ experience.  She gets support from her husband who works in construction.

She’s requesting a loan to buy a hemming machine and necessary supplies to continue manufacturing shirts and backpacks and improve her profits.  In future she hopes to hire employees and to have more customers.

loans.use: to buy a special sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Mti Pesa Group

texts.en:
Idrissa, who is in his late 20s, is single with no children. He has had a cafe business for four years now. He works from 6am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Idrissa has successfully repaid all his previous loans which he used to buy a freezer for his business. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of soft drinks. His dream is to one day be able to sell soft drinks at wholesale and retail prices.

Idrissa will share this loan with his loan group "Mti Pesa" which totals 13 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina tiene 27 años y nació en Manizales, Colombia.  Ella estudió Artes Plásticas en la Universidad Pública de Caldas gracias a que recibía estímulos socio-económicos por parte del gobierno Colombiano. En estos momentos Valentina no cuenta con un trabajo fijo y dedica gran parte de su tiempo acompañar a su mamá que se encuentra muy enferma.

Valentina tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en EEUU o el Reino Unido y el apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que ella pueda pagar los cursos de preparación del TOEFL, la inscripción al examen y la aplicación a varias universidades que resultan muy costosas. También serviría para que pueda pagar los costos del envío de su Portafolio y documentos.

Aquí está su historia:

Al terminar el pregrado en Artes, apenas empezaba una nueva etapa de mi vida. Desde entonces, cada decisión que he tomado, ha sido pensando en alcanzar el sueño de Estudiar un Master en Fine Arts. A lo largo de estos años me he esforzado por  mantenerme fiel a mi actividad creadora, brindándome el tiempo que conlleva la dedicación y la disciplina; y aunque esto signifique pocas entradas económicas, me pone un gran reto personal y profesional como artista. 

He luchado por esos ideales día tras día, equilibrando el tiempo de enseñanza y la practica artística; compartiendo con otros mi pasión por la pintura, el color y la forma he enseñado  a niños, jóvenes y adultos; junto con la asistencia a talleres y  participación en exposiciones, he ido construyendo una mejor calidad de vida como artista y tratando de con poco hacer mucho. Creo como bien dice Fernando Gonzalez que: “ Los que triunfan, lo deben a una creencia arraigada, generalmente a la creencia en si mismos” 

Ahora quiero alcanzar este sueño y en mi camino me encontré con el Semillero de Talentos regionales y KIVA, los cuales han sido y serán un gran soporte personal y profesional en una etapa en la cual necesito financiar las aplicaciones a las universidades, pagar los cursos de preparación y exámenes del TOEFL IBT.

Con su ayuda, pretendo poder llevar este sueño a una realidad. Realidad que me envuelve no solo a mí, sino  a mi comunidad. Con la cual a mi regreso del estudio, quisiera realizar un impacto a nivel de emprendimiento a través de la enseñanza a niños; compartiendo experiencias que  fortalezcan los programas de Arte en mi ciudad, para lograr un impacto en cuanto a la calidad de los mismos y al fortalecimiento de sus contenido, motivando a otros estudiantes para que como yo, nunca duden en luchar por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Valentina, age 27, was born in Manizales, Colombia.  She studied Visual Arts at the Universidad Pública de Caldas.  This is thanks to the socio-economic incentives she received from the Colombian government.  At this time Valentina does not have a steady job, and she devotes a large part of her time with her mother, who is very ill.

Valentina’s dream is to get a Master’s Degree in the United States or the United Kingdom.  The support from Kiva would help her be able to pay for the preparation courses for TOEL, registration for the exam, and the applications to various universities, which are very expensive.  With Kiva support she would also be able to pay for the cost of sending out her portfolio and documents.

Here is her story:

Upon finishing my undergraduate studies in Art, I have just started a new stage of my life.  Since then every decision I have made has been thinking about reaching my dream of studying for a Master’s in Fine Arts.  During these years I have made a great effort to stay true to my creative activity, affording myself the dedication and discipline that it involves.  Even though this signifies little financial benefits, I am setting a big goal personally and professionally as an artist.

I have struggled for these goals day after day.  I have balanced my instruction time and my artistic practice time.  I am sharing my passion for painting, color, and form with others.  I have taught children, youth, and adults.  Along with attending workshops and participating in expositions, I have been building a better quality of life as an artist.  I am trying to do much with little.  I believe, as Fernando Gonzalez well said, “Those who triumph owe it to a strong belief, generally a belief in themselves.”

I now want to reach this dream, and along the way I found the regional Semillero de Talentos [“Seedbed” of Talent] and Kiva.  They have been, and will be, a great personal and professional support in a time when I need to pay for the university applications, the preparation courses, and the TOEFL IBT exams.

With your help I hope to be able to makes this dream a reality that embraces not just me, but my community as well.  With this, upon my return from studying, I would like to make an impact on an entrepreneurial level by teaching children and sharing experiences that strengthen the Art programs in my city.  I would like to make an impact on the quality of the programs and the strength of their content.  I would like to motivate other sudents so that they, like me, never hesitate to fight for their dreams.

loans.use: to pay the application expenses for her studies for a Master's in Studio Arts.

loans.name: Daniel Rosendo

texts.es:
DANIEL ROSENDO tiene 44 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y 6 años de edad, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

DANIEL ROSENDO se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo poder superarce para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es trabajar este año para mejorar la condición de vida de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce los fines de semana en la casa con toda la familia.
texts.en:
Daniel Rosendo, 44, is single and has 2 children, ages 10 and 6. He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He is a member of the communal bank BRUNIQUILDE, located in Calabi in Ventanas canton, and he is a farmer. He grows corn and Gandul beans. He is requesting this loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, and liquid weed killer. He purchase his supplies in Ventanas every two weeks.

With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies. His challenge is to succeed for the sake of his family's well-being. This year his dream is to improve his family's circumstances. He loves spending his free time on the weekends at home with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Elena Pilar

texts.es:
ELENA PILAR tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

ELENA PILAR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas  y en la parroquia San Carlos cada 20 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos y cambiaria mucho el estilo de vida de la familia porque va haber un ingreso más significativo.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo poder superarce para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es trabajar para mejorar la relación con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta dialogar y trabajar mucho con los hermanos.
texts.en:
Elena Pilar, 28, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Bruniquilde” communal bank located in Recinto Calabi that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture.

Elena Pilar works growing corn. She’s requesting the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and weed killer.

She buys her products in the city of Ventanas and in San Carlos Parish every 20 days.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy supplies and her family’s lifestyle will change quite a bit because income will be more significant.

The challenge she faces is to improve her family’s wellbeing and her dream is to work to improve her relationship with her family.  She likes chatting and working with her siblings in her free time very much.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu, 36, is a mother of three children aged between 5 and 21 years old and lives at Kakata, Liberia with her husband. She stopped her education in the 6th grade.

Bendu has a table at the market in her community  where she  sells  peppers, salt, palm oil,  rice and charcoal retail. She has been involved in this business for the past seven years. She started this business with a little amount that she received from her husband. She is now proud of her business and feels independent because, with the profit that she generates from each sale, she buys more goods and contributes with the expenditures in the   home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal, peppers, palm oil, rice, and bags of salt to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal, peppers, palm oil, rice, and bags of salt to increase her sales.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no estaban siendo suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio con el que pudiera contribuir económicamente pero al mismo tiempo pudiera estar pendiente al cuidado de sus hijos.  Fue así como montó una tienda general en su casa en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar, y gracias a esta ahora su familia ha venido mejorando la calidad de vida y espera que con esta puedan superar las dificultades económicas de su hogar. La mayor oportunidad que le ha brindado este negocio es poder ofrecerles a sus hijos el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad, y por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días para que este le siga brindando mayores posibilidades para su familia. Buscando aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, Luz Adriana busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es lograr sacar su negocio adelante y que este le permita brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para su sostenimiento. Además, aspira a que en un futuro esta sea una fuente de ingresos que apoye el sueño de conseguir la casa propia para la familia.
texts.en:
Luz Adriana’s married and has two children who are 6 and 10 years old.  Because the income her husband generated was insufficient to meet all household expenses she decided to open her own business so that she could contribute economically to the family while still being able to watch her children.  This is how she set up a general store at home where she stocks basic staples for her customers and thanks to this her family’s quality of life has been improving.  She hopes to be able to overcome her home’s economic difficulties.

The greatest opportunity this business has afforded her is to be able to provide her children with access to a better quality education and this is why she works hard every day so that it will continue providing her family with better possibilities.  Aiming at increasing the variety of products she has in stock, Luz Adriana is looking for financing to buy basic staple items and thus offer more variety to her customers.

Her greatest dream is to move the business forward so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family and to have better financial wherewithal for their support.  In addition, she hopes in future that it will be a source of income that will lead to her reaching her greatest dream: to get a house of her own for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get his driver's license.

loans.name: Juana Verenisse

texts.es:
Juana es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a su familia y solventar sus gastos, no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver diversas películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Juana trabaja como Cajera en una cafetería de su ciudad, todos los días ella asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que actualmente su pequeño hogar está construido de esteras; de esta manera ella espera poder contar con dicha habitación para que su familia pueda estar en ella con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así Juana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y desea junto a su familia poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juana, 18, is a single young woman living with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  Despite being so young, she’s a kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, because she needed to work to help support her family and cover her expenses, she’s been unable to study a professional career but dreams with being able to do so someday.  In her free time she enjoys watching different movies and sometimes cooks a delicious “Arroz Chaufa” [Chinese-style fried rice] to share with her family.

Juana works very diligently and enthusiastically as a cashier in a local cafeteria.  She heads to work every day and believes that she does well because of her good work habits and the kind customer service she provides.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they give her she will be able to add a room to her house because her house is currently built with matting and this way she’ll be able to have said room so that her family and she can have better security and wellbeing.  Juana will thus continue working and striving to reach her great dream of becoming a good professional.  She hopes to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to add a room to her house.

loans.name: Agnella

texts.en:
Agnella is a noble mother who is responsible for five single children, two of whom are attending school. She is 48 years old and married to Gabriel. She is operating a retail shop located opposite her residential house. Aside from this, she farms some vegetables that she sells to help cover her little expenses. To help cover their daily expenses and allowances for their children, Agnella’s husband works as a teacher to share his responsibilities for the family.

At the present, Agnella would like to acquire a loan through Yehu and Kiva to purchase flour, sugar, snacks, etc. She hopes that lenders will offer her this loan, which can better her living status.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a humble and ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she provides M-Pesa services (money transfer via mobile phone). She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a viable business environment and her primary customers are employees from institutions nearby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the float shortage for the M-pesa retail business. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan as a float for M-pesa services. Her business goal is to run another similar retail shop within five years. Mercy has taken two previous loans from SMEP DTM which she managed to pay back successfully.

loans.use: to increase her float.

loans.name: James   Irungu

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and has four children who are in school. He sells cabbages in a busy environment with reliable customers to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and employs two people. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. 

He dreams of expanding his business and buying a lorry for easy transportation of his goods. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy cabbages to sell.

loans.use: To buy cabbages.

loans.name: Bon Berger 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 47 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. He is representing the Bon Berger 2 (#2) group. Vincent sells a variety of home and business chairs, which he has been doing for five years. 

Vincent is requesting his first loan from HOPE Congo, which he will use to buy more chairs to sell in his shop. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. As Vincent’s business continues to grow, he hopes to open a bakery shop.

loans.use: to purchase chairs.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah sells clothes to earn a living. She is requesting her second loan from Faulu Kenya for 55,000 KES, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  Her previous loan of 40,000 KES helped her to buy clothes thereby increasing her profits. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Ildaura

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
