Este crédito es para comprar pollos, sodas y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos así como también ropa y productos Yanbal. Lleva 11 años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Tosagua Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  It's known for being a very dynamic place where, because it's an area with a lot of vegetation, the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals.

Monserrate, 38, lives here.  She's married and from this relationship has two daughters, ages 18 and 4.  The older one is a college student.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a rotisserie chicken restaurant in a place she rents downtown.  She works there every day from 2 p.m. until 10 p.m.  Also, in the morning she works selling clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She also sells these things in her place if a customer needs something.  She has had her business for more than 19 years and it always has gone very well for her.

This loan is to buy chicken, soda, and various provisions to make the dishes, as well as clothing and Yanbal products.

She has been in the communal bank for 11 years.  She's the fiscal regulator and she likes it because of the help with loans that the institution gives her.

Her dream is to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soda, provisions, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Carmen Orlinda Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron hace varios años atrás, el que tiene vivo ya es mayor de edad y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir con los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ventas y también por las tardes ella prepara y vende corviches, tortillas y empanadas para lo cual improvisa un pequeño kiosco en la afueras de su casa lugar hasta donde acuden sus clientes en las tardes y noches que es cuando vende sus alimentos,  tiene más  de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Carmen, 62, lives here.  She’s married and had three children but two of them died several years ago.  The surviving one is an adult now but still lives at home.  Her husband’s retired.

She’s a housewife who in order to have her own source of income to contribute towards household expenses works selling all types of clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day at her sales and in the evening makes corviches [deep-fried plantain dough stuffed with fish, peanuts, onions and spices], tortillas and turnovers to sell.  To do so, she improvises a small kiosk outside her house where her customers come by in the evening and at night which is when she sells her food.  She’s been doing this for more than 15 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfume, shoes, creams and cosmetics, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because the group is very united and trustworthy.  Her dream is that she and her family have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Estela Ramona

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Estela, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, cuatro ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno para lo cual se desplaza hasta los campos aledaños a comprar el ganado y luego lo transporta a los centros de faenamiento en la localidad donde vende las vacas a los comerciantes de carne de este lugar, realiza esto por tres a cuatro días por semana ya que también lleva las vacas hasta la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez dos veces a la semana.

Este crédito es para comprar ganado. Lleva cinco ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño es comprar un camión más grande para que su esposo realice su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Estela, 45, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has six children.  Four of them are adults now and two who are 16 and 12 years old attend secondary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She, like a good housewife, is requesting the loan so that her husband can use it in his business.  He buys and sells cattle.  To do so, he heads out to neighboring fields to buy the cattle which he then transports to slaughter houses where he sells the cows to meat merchants there.  He does this for three to four days per week since he also transports cattle to the city of Bahía de Caraquez twice a week.

This loan is to buy cattle.  She’s been in the communal bank for five cycles and likes it because the loans are quick and don’t have so many requirements.  Her dream is to buy a larger truck so that her husband can do his work.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Shelly Dominixts

texts.es:
Shelly es una joven de 20 años la cual es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura y también en la ganadería, posee varios atractivos turísticos entre los cuales encontramos la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando Shelly tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Pizza”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Shelly solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Medico.

Con mucho empeño Shelly trabaja en un supermercado de la ciudad como empleada, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que por las noches y con el fruto de su trabajo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Secretariado ejecutivo; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Shelly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, con la cual podrá realizar sus trabajo y prácticas, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herramienta y le es difícil el cumplir con la realización de sus trabajos, así de esta manera seguirá estudiando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Shelly, 20, is a very hardworking, enthusiastic young woman.  She lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture and animal husbandry are also common here.  It also has several tourist attractions like the Huacachina Lagoon which is visited by many tourists year-round.  When Shelly has free time available she enjoys listening to music very much and takes advantage of some occasions to enjoy one of her favorite dishes: pizza.  Because of Shelly’s limited economic resources she was only able to study up to fifth grade in secondary school but would have liked to study to become a doctor.

Shelly works very hard as an employee in a local supermarket.  She works about 8 hours per day and at night, thanks to her efforts at work, is taking an executive secretary course.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s responsible and very much wants to get ahead.

Shelly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help  they are giving her she will be able to buy a computer that she will be able to use to do her work and homework since she currently does not own this tool and it’s difficult to do her assigned work without it.  In this way, she will continue studying and striving to make her greatest dream a reality: to be a great professional and her parents’ source of pride.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es Ing. Agrónomo.

Ella se dedican al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, bisutería y varios accesorios mas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y es allí donde ella pasa el mayor tiempo del dia y no se le hace complicado ya que además de ganar sus propios ingresos allí mismo les ayuda a sus hijos en sus tareas y esta al pendiente de lo que ellos necesiten, lleva 10 años con su negocio el mismo que empezó con poca mercadería y  lo ha ido mejorando con el paso de los días.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, bisutería, zapatos y todo lo que ella vende en su local. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su negocio.

Su sueño es darles siempre lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tosagua Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. It's known for being a very dynamic place where, because it's an area with a lot of vegetation, the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals.

Martha, 41, lives here.  She's married and from this relationship has two children, ages 12 and 10, who are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is an agronomic engineer.

She works in business.  She has a place in her house where she sells all types of clothing, shoes, wallets, costume jewelry, and various other accessories.  She works every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She always has liked to work and that's where she spends most of her day.  It's not complicated and, in addition to earning her own income, she can help her children with their homework right there and be watching for whatever they need.  She has had the business for 10 years.  She started it herself with very little merchandise and has improved it a little bit along with the passing of time.

This loan is to buy clothing, wallets, costume jewelry, shoes, and everything she sells in her store.  She has been in the communal bank for seven years and she likes it because the loans are a big help with her business.

Her dream is to always give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, wallets, costume jewelry, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer 34 años, se encuentra felizmente casada, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su razón principal en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Mirian puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, todos las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella asiste a un mercadillo de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas, Mirian trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes 
Miriam se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor mercadería, tales como verduras y frutas de la estación; de esta manera Mirian tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido con mayor variedad de frutas y verduras para así poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un  futuro no muy lejano pueda cumplir su gran sueño de ver convertidos a sus hijos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is happily married and lives in the city of Chiclayo with her husband and three children who she loves and is her main reason to live.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who together with her husband focuses all their efforts into moving their family forward.  Unfortunately, because of the need to work in order to support her parents, she was unable to study to become a teacher like she so wanted to but would have loved to do so.  In her free time she likes sharing pleasant moments with her family.

With much effort, Miriam started a small business selling fruit and vegetables.  She starts work very early every morning.  She goes to her local market to sell her products.  She works about 8 hours daily and believes she does well because of her dedication and the kind way she treats her customers.

Miriam is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy larger amounts of merchandise like seasonal fruit and vegetables so that her business will be better stocked with a wider variety of fruit and vegetables to increase sales and income that will serve much so that in the not too distant future she’ll see her children become good professionals and upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando  es un señor de 61 años de edad y vive con su esposa en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en el cantón de Turrialba ubicado en la  provincia de Cartago. La ciudad de Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823, se caracteriza por tener un  relieve montañoso formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca, su clima es frío la mayoría del año consecuencia de los dos volcanes que posee llamados  Irazú y Turrialba.
Fernando trabaja limpiando jardines en su comunidad y en comunidades aledañas,  para  realizar este  trabajo con eficiencia necesita comprar una máquina  para cortar zacate , de esta manera podrá tener mayor clientela y  desarrollar esta actividad con mayor rapidez. El está solicitando  un crédito por trescientos mil colones exactos (¢300.000) para adquirir esta herramienta.
Fernando forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con él espera logra su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fernando, 61, lives with his wife in the community of Santa Teresita in Turrialba Canton located in Cartago Province.  The city of Cartago was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823 and it’s noted for its characteristic two mountain ranges: Central and Talamanca.  Its climate is cold most of the year due to the two volcanos, Irazú and Turrialba, nearby.

Fernando works as a gardener in his community and in neighboring communities.  To do his work efficiently he needs to buy a lawnmower so that he can increase his clientele and carry out his work more quickly.  He’s asking for a 300,000 colon loan (¢300.000) to buy this tool.

Fernando is a member of the El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba communal bank, one of the 110 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he hopes to reach his objective with it.

loans.use: to buy a lawnmower.

loans.name: Fernando Manfredo

texts.es:
El señor Fernando Manfredo es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, curso sus estudios de maestros en educación, tiene 2 hijos, trabaja para la empresa de energía eléctrica de Guatemala, lleva 11 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para comprar una computadora, que le servirá para apoyar la educacion de sus hijos, ya que actualmente para hacer tareas se usan las computadoras, espera ver a sus hijos bien preparados educativamente, y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Fernando Manfredo, 34, is married.  He studied to be a teacher.  He has two children.  He works for the Guatemala electric company and has 11 years’ experience.

He’s requesting a loan to buy a computer that will help with his children’s school work since nowadays they need computers to do their school assignments.  He intends his children to be well prepared academically and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mayra Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señorita Mayra, tiene 20 años  de edad y está soltera, está estudiando en la Universidad y vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella es una joven muy trabajadora  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder seguir adelante con sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que sale a recorrer de tres a cuatro días a la semana unas  tres horas al día, la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedidos que le hacen sus clientes con anticipación, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. La ropa la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más barato y hay más variedad. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito con la institución, el otro crédito que recibió le fue de mucha ayuda ya que con las ganancias que obtuvo ella pudo matricularse y pudo comenzar sus estudios universitarios, ella quiere un nuevo crédito para poder invertir en su negocio y así obtener sus ingresos para poder lograr sus metas que son ser una gran profesional. Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para seguir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The September 7th Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited during all seasons and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Mayra, who is 20 years old and single.  She is studying at the university and lives at home with her parents.

She is a very hard-working young woman, who works selling all types of clothing in order to have her own resources, which allow her to continue studying.  She makes her sales door to door, working three or four days a week for about three hours each day.  The majority of her sales come from orders that her customers place in advance.  She offers her products on credit and collects her payments every eight days.  She purchases the clothing in Guayaquil since she can get it less expensive and there is more variety.  She has worked for three years doing this and it is going well.

She is requesting another loan with the organization.  The other loan that she received was a great help to her since with the earnings that she obtained she could pay her tuition and begin her studies at the university.  She would like a new loan to be able to invest in her business and thus, acquire more income to be able to achieve her goal of becoming a great professional.  This loan is to purchase all types of clothing.  She has had three loan cycles in the communal bank and she enjoys it because the loans are very important in moving ahead.

Her dreams are to finish her studies and be a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Amen 2 Group

texts.en:
Arsene, age 50, is married with four children, ages 3 to 22 years old. He has two children currently attending school. He is representing the Amen 2 group. 

Arsene has a stand in the market where he sells a variety of household products. He has been operating this business for three years. He will use the loan to buy boxes, plaster, and scotch tape. His business strategy is to market his products near a large depot in his market. 

This is Arsene’s first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. His group members and HOPE are confident he will be able to repay the loan. Arsene hopes to continue to grow and have a large household goods store.

loans.use: to pay for boxes, plaster, and tape.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señorita Juana Paula esta soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, cursa el sexto año de educación secundaria, a punto de graduarse de maestra de educación, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio con su padre, ya hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para pagar sus estudios de ultimo año de magisterio, espera seguir preparándose, espera que con su negocio de tejeduría, también tenga trabajadores en el futuro, para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Paula is a 21-year-old single woman.  She is in her sixth year of secondary education and is close to graduating with a degree in education.

She currently makes her living as a weaver. She started this business with her father and has two years of experience so far.

She is seeking a loan that she will use to pay for her final year of her course of study.  She hopes to continue to better herself, and hopes that in the future she will be able to hire workers in her weaving business, so that she can help to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her last year of studies.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has four children, three of whom attend school. He is a fishmonger, a trade that he has been involved in for four years. He also earns a salary from poultry farming.

Samson learned about Milango through a friend and aims to access credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the fluctuating market, due to the seasonal business climate.

Samson is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy a new batch of chicks. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand to be a wholesale fishmonger.

loans.use: to buy a new batch of chicks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children who attend school. He has operated a retail shop for 10 years. He also earns income from selling second-hand clothes.
He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. His main challenges are high taxes and high transport costs and fuel.
Joseph is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of electric gadgets to sell in his shop, such as bulbs and heaters. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His dream is to expand and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of electric gadgets to sell such as bulbs and heaters.

loans.name: Angel Aparicio

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 40 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su hermana, a quien quiere mucho y agradece toda el apoyo que le ha brindado, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace 2 años Ángel puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y adicionalmente de bebidas como cerveza y vinos, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, dedicando un aproximado de12 horas, él cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Ángel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, bebidas, entre otros; de esta manera Ángel tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano utilizará para poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángel, 40, is single.  He lives in the city of Ica with his sister, whom he loves very much and thanks for all the support she has given him.

He's a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself.  Unfortunately, because of the need to work from a very young age to pay for his expenses, he couldn't study for a professional career, but he very much would like to have been able to do it.

With great effort and enthusiasm, two years ago Ángel started his small business selling groceries and beverages such as beer and wine.  Every day he starts work very early, working approximately 12 hours.  He believes it's going well for him because of the variety of products and the pleasant manner with which he serves his customers.

Ángel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, soda, and beverages, among other things.  This way Ángel will have a better stocked business, with which he hopes to increase his sales and his income, which he will use in the near future to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jenny Janina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 36 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo de 19 años que  estudia en universidad. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella para ganarse la vida y así ayudar a  su hijo en sus estudios se dedica al comercio,  tiene un local en su casa en la cual vende ropa americana, zapatos, carteras, entre otros productos que le envían de los Estados Unidos, trabaja todos los días en su negocio y también prepara comida y bocadillos para un centro de eventos sociales de la ciudad, actividad que realiza hasta dos veces por semana y con lo cual se gana una buena cantidad por la venta de estos platos, lleva  más de 9 años con su negocio y  es así como ha logrado sacar adelante sola a su hijo para que este sea una persona de bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito el cual le fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo pagar una mercadería que le llego en esos días, en su negocio como siempre ha tenido días muy buenos y otros no tanto pero este le permite salir adelante y darle a su hijo una muy buena educación. Este crédito es para compra ropa, zapatos, carteras y víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Seventh of September" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Jenny lives in this place. She is 36 years old and is a single mother with a 19-year-old son who is studying in the university. She has been in the communal bank for four loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans are quick and don't have too many requirements.

She works in commerce in order to earn a living and thus help her son with his studies. She has a shop in her house where she sells American clothing, shoes, and purses, among other products, that they send her from the United States. She works in her business every day, and she also prepares food and appetizers for a social events center in the city, a business that she works in up to two times a week and from which she earns a good amount by selling these dishes. She has had this business for more than 9 years, and this is how she has managed to raise her son alone so that he could become a good person.

She is repeating the loan that was of so much help to her, since she was able to pay for the merchandise that arrived for her during this time. In her business, as always, she has had very good days and others that were not so good, but it has allowed her to advance and to give her son a very good education. This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and purses (for her store) and groceries to prepare her delicious dishes.

Her dream is to have a big restaurant in the city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, purses for her store and food items for her catering business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 59 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City. Maria is married with eight children, all adults. Maria has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 30 years. Maria requested a loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products such as fashion jewelry, bags, soaps, and cosmetics. Maria has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Maria hopes to save for emergencies and use her profits to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase fashion jewelry, bags, soaps and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a resident of Malindi in Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She owns a retail shop, which she has been operating for one year. She also sells coconuts.

She learned about Milango through a friend and aims to access credit to improve the operation of her business. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and purchasing stock.

Rehema is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase some maize flour, sugar, cereals, and other items for the shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and save some money. She aspires to own a wholesale business in future.

loans.use: to purchase some maize flour, sugar, cereals, and other items for the shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 31, is married with one child and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rosita has owned a general store for eight years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP through her business. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, beverages and other stock to sell.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, toothpaste and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks and increase his stock of basic food products.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Valor Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes!

Gloria es uno de los miembros del Grupo  “Fuerza y Valor”, una alcancía comunal con 7 integrantes que durante los 2 ciclos que están trabajando con EDAPROSPO han demostrado que son personas  emprendedoras y responsables. La socia Gloria es también la presidenta del grupo. 

Gloria tiene 35 años, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace más de 6 años. Sus principales clientes son familiares  y vecinos de la zona. Ella comenzó  con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Fruto de su esfuerzo, ha mejorado su vivienda y apoyado en la educación de sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo, Gloria quiere invertir en la compra de colonias, talcos, cremas, perfumes, y así tener un stock guardado.

El sueño de Gloria es terminar su carrera de enfermería, ya que dejó de estudiar por falta de dinero.

Gloria agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.  En la foto, ella está ubicada en la parte posterior y viste una chompa con raya ploma rosada y blanca. En la foto aparecen también los hijos de algunas socias, que acompañaran sus madres a la oficina en el día del desembolso.
texts.en:
Good afternoon!

Gloria is one of the members of the group “Fuerza y Valor” (Strength and Valor). The seven members of this Communal Bank have participated in two loan cycles while working with EDAPROSPO. They have demonstrated that they are enterprising and responsible individuals. Gloria also serves as president of the group.

Glora is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been selling beauty products for more than six years. Her main customers are relatives and neighbors in the area. Gloria started her business so that she could improve her income and provide a better quality of life for her family. As a result of her efforts, she has been able to make improvements to her home and support her children with their education.

With this loan, Gloria will invest in the purchase of colognes, talcum powders, crèmes, and perfumes so that she will have an inventory of products. Gloria dreams of finishing her nursing degree since she was had to quit her studies due to a lack of funds. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance they have provided.

In the photograph, Gloria is standing in the back and wearing a sweater with purple and white stripes. The children of some of the group members also appear in the photo since they came to the office with their mothers on the day of the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy colognes, talcum powders, crèmes, and perfumes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para su hijo, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, María puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropas, todas los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella vende prendas de vestir tanto para hombres, mujeres y niños, María puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la variedad, novedades en prendas de vestir y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: polos, blusas, chompas, pantalones, buzos, entre otras prendas; de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco ahorrará para que pueda asegurar el bienestar y la educación de su pequeño, ya que sueña con verlo convertirse en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 36. She lives in the city of Ica with her young son. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to raising her little one. Unfortunately, for various reasons, she separated from her partner several years ago. Since then she has been father and mother for her son. Unfortunately, because she has needed to work to pay her expenses since she was very young, she was not able to study for a career, but she very much would have liked to do it.

With great effort and enthusiasm, Maria set up her little business of selling clothes. Every day she begins her work at a very early hour. She sells articles of clothing for men, women, and children. She can work approximately 10 hours a day, and she believes that her business is going well for her because of the variety and newness of her clothing and because of the friendly treatment she offers her customers.

Maria is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered to her she will be able to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, blouses, sweaters, pants, and exercise outfits, among other items. In this way, Maria will have her business well stocked. With this, she hopes to increase her sales and income, which little by little she will save so that she can assure the well-being and education of her little one, since she dreams of seeing him become a good professional and a good man.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polo shorts, blouses, sweaters, pants, exercise outfits, etc.

loans.name: Krauch

texts.en:
Krauch lives from Ang Snoul district. She raises hogs to fatten for future sale. She installed a few piglets at her backyard pigsty. She plans to breed pigs for offspring as well in the future. In parallel, her spouse is dedicated to poultry raising business on their own farm. 

This couple is very industrious in their daily tasks. Krauch and her spouse aim to have a farm where they can develop their business activities towards the attainment of their goals. Together, they have three school-aged children.

Recently, Krauch would like to take out a loan through HKL, a reliable MFI, to purchase additional poultry for raising. This loan will enable Krauch and her husband to make sustainability for their current businesses. She hopes that they can earn a better income when they sell all their mature pigs and birds.

loans.use: to purchase additional poultry for raising.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is a single parent aged 30 and living at Kakata.  She has two children, ages 4 and 13, and they live with their grandfather. She stopped her education in the 12th grade.

She sells sardines, bath soap, washing soap, candy, biscuits, chloride, batteries, and other items for the past two years. She started as a housemaid before getting into business, but she likes this type of business because she earns her own income and feels independent. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bath soap, washing soap, biscuit, candy, and sardines for the business.  Her future plan is to build house

loans.use: to buy more bath soap, washing soap, biscuits, candy, and sardines for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 36-year-old married woman who has three children whose ages range from three to 11. She describes herself as friendly and a listener. Susan has operated a retail business where she sells poultry for the past two years. Her business is located near a busy town and her primary customers are hotels and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for purchasing chickens to sell. 

Susan will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy layer chickens to mix with the broiler chickens which she already has. Her business goal is to be a supplier of poultry within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will venture into a new business of having rental houses. Susan's husband is employed at a hospital and sometimes helps her with funds for her business.

loans.use: to buy layer chickens

loans.name: Gonno Group

texts.en:
Gonno is a group which has two members and is based at Teshie. The members are Grace and Gladys who sell items such as firewood, provisions and jewelry. They have been together for two years and are taking out their third loan from ID-Ghana.

Gladys is a 56-year-old single woman with two adult children. Her children do not live with her but sometimes come back to help their mother to sell. She sells firewood and provisions. She has 15 years of experience in this work and has employed one person to help her. 

Gladys is requesting a loan of 900 Ghana cedis from Kiva through ID-Ghana in order to buy firewood and provisions to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business. Together, they need an amount of 1,700 Ghana cedis to buy more goods for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy firewood and provisions to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, gold plated jewelry, and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a married man who has two children aged two and four. He describes himself as a social, optimistic and determined man. Edgar operates a posho mill (used to grind maize and millet) from where he sells flour. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of the fuel used in the posho mill machine. 

Edgar will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize to grind into maize flour to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale posho mill services business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and cater for his family's financial needs with the profits he will earn. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy maize to grind into maize flour to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 43 años, es una mujer carismática, luchadora y con ganas de progresar. Su pareja es Gerardo, quien es agricultor, con él tiene dos hijos de 21 y 4 años. Junto a ellos vive en su casa propia, la que compraron gracias a los años de ahorros con su pareja.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de jugos. Tiene un puesto en el mercado principal de su localidad. Trabaja todos los días, desde muy temprano preparando todo tipo de desayunos, elaborados con panes y distintas carnes y lo acompaña con diversos jugos de frutas frescas. Lleva en este negocio 6 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Comparte esta actividad con otro negocio, en el que se desempeña por las tardes, de manera ocasional, que es un taller de soldadura que aperturó hace 6 meses y en el que principalmente trabaja su cónyuge, ella se encarga de la administración y abastecimiento de repuestos y accesorios que pone a la venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar en contacto constante con el público, le gusta conocer las preferencias de sus clientes y qué es lo que demandan para que pueda seguir mejorando. Ambas actividades le brindan la tranquilidad que necesita para enfrentar los gastos básicos de su familia y contribuir de esta manera al sostenimiento de sus hijos. Ahora anhela implementar su taller de soldadura porque siente que en su actividad de venta de jugos tiene todo lo necesario para trabajar cómodamente. 

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes. No quiere dejar de pagar por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable. 

Con el préstamo solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, comprará una máquina de soldadura con la que espera desarrollar un mejor trabajo en su taller y brindar un servicio de calidad, otra pequeña parte del dinero la invertirá en la compra de frutas, cuya inversión alcanza los 300 soles semanales.
texts.en:
Aurelia, age 43, is a charismatic and determined woman who desires to make progress. Her partner Gerardo is a farmer and they have two children, ages 21 and 4. They live in their own home which they bought thanks to her partner’s savings that he accumulated over the years.

Aurelia’s work involves selling juices. She has a stand at the main market in her town. Aurelia works every day and begins every morning by preparing all types of breakfast foods, such as breads and different meats, along with various fresh fruit juices. She has been in business for six years and works with the help of her grown daughter. Aurelia also has another business that she manages on occasion in the afternoons. She opened a metal shop six months ago and her partner has the main responsibility of running it. Aurelia is in charge of managing the shop and keeping it stocked with parts and accessories for sale. She enjoys working because it allows her to remain in constant contact with the public. Aurelia likes to know her customers’ preferences and what products are in demand so that she can keep improving. Both of her businesses give her the peace of mind that she needs to handle the basic family expenses and to support her children. She now wants to focus on keeping her metal shop in operation because she feels her juice business has everything necessary to keep running.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Aurelia is excited and appreciative about having the financial backing to continue with her plans. She does not want to fall behind on her payments, so she promises to be punctual and responsible. With this loan of 2,500 PEN, Aurelia will buy a welding machine so that she can improve her metal shop and provide quality service. A small portion of the loan will be used to buy fruit, which requires an investment of 300 PEN per week.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for her metal shop and fruit for her juice business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man who has five children aged between seven and 20. He describes himself to be God-fearing and social. He operates a retail stall where he sells electronic products. Omar's business is located within a market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. 

Omar will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy electonic products to sell. His business goal is to run an electronics installation company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business performance. This is Omar's first loan.

loans.use: to buy electronic products to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 27-year-old married man who has a two-year-old daughter. He describes himself to be ambitious, God-fearing, honest and generous. John has a motorcycle which he uses to provide motorcycle transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic business area and his primary customers are local business people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be disturbances by the local city council. 

John will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years so he can provide transportation services to customers to meet their increasing needs. He hopes that in the future, he will build a real estate property. Previously, John was employed as a shopkeeper's assistant.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza tiene 37 años, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora y con ganas de superación. Está separada de su pareja, pero vive con su hijo de 10 años, en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus hermanos.
Su trabajo es la compra y venta de diversos artículos de uso del hogar y artículos personales, como ropa y zapatos. Su mercadería con mayor demanda es la que se usa en la cocina, como ollas, utensilios de mesa, sartenes, baldes, entre otros. También ofrece accesorios para los niños de la casa, como juguetes didácticos que contribuyen al desarrollo de su inteligencia. Ha instalado su negocio en al casa donde vive. Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 9 años, antes trabajaba sola, pero ahora o hace con ayuda de su madre. Su horario es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera buena rentabilidad gracias a que en su sector no tiene competencia y es el único negocio dedicado a estos artículos. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y gracias a su trabajo ha salido de muchos apuros económicos. Tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal, donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria. Agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio y esta convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará bandejas, baldes y artículos de cocina para continuar vendiendo en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Eliza is 37 years old. She is a happy and entrepreneurial woman with a will to achieve. She is separated from her partner, but she lives with her son, who is 10, in her parents' house, along with her siblings.

Her work is buying and selling various household and personal articles, such as clothing and shoes. The merchandise for which there is greater demand is kitchen items, such as pots, table utensils, and trays, among other items. She also offers items for children, such as learning games, which contribute to the development of their intelligence. She has set up her business in the house where she lives. She has worked in this area for 9 years. In the past she worked alone, but now she works with the help of her mother. Her schedule is from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. What she likes about this work is that it generates good profits for her, thanks to the fact that there is no competition in her area and it is the only business selling these items.

She feels happy since it has brought her great satisfaction, and thanks to her work she has gotten out of many economic difficulties. She has a great will to continue working and to be able to expand her business.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. She has always been a good member of her communal bank, where she is much loved for being very responsible and united with her fellow members. She is thankful to those who offer her the loan that she needs to continue increasing her business, and she is convinced that she will continue being a very punctual client and will make her payments on time, as she did with all the loans that she has had up until now.

With the 1500 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy trays, buckets, and cooking utensils to continue selling in this season.

loans.use: to buy trays, buckets, and cooking items so that she can continue selling in this season

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, aged 44, has three adult children and is from the mountainous region of Isabela. To meet her family's daily needs, she decided to help her spouse by earning additional income. Marilou is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase products like clothes, slippers and herbal medicine to sell in her community. Marilou hopes that her business will expand.

loans.use: to purchase products like clothes, slippers and herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Willialet

texts.en: Willialet is 29 years old and the mother of two children. To provide for their educational needs, she operates a business which sells firewood. She earns income for all their expenses from this business. Willialet is very willing to expand her source of income; the only problem is that she lacks capital. Thus, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 which she will use to purchase more firewood. She is sure that this will make her business grow. She will become more hard-working and patient in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a resident of Catadman Manabay, Ozamis City and owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. It therefore makes sense that the items that she has listed to buy from her loan are firewood, bananas, candies, chucheria (sweets), and rice. Estrella has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase 50 bundles of firewood, 20 kilos of ripe bananas, candies, chucheria (sweets), and a couple of sacks of rice.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, bananas, candies, chucheria (sweets), and rice.

loans.name: Fredy Carlos

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 30 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, entre otros. Fredy es un hombre muy trabajador, el estudio la carrera de Mecánica, pero al no encontrar empleo poco a poco fue ahorrando y con esfuerzo logro comprar una mototaxi y decidió trabajar como chofer de mototaxi. 

Día a día Fredy trabaja con mucho entusiasmo, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque conduce de manera responsable y sobre todo trata con amabilidad a sus clientes.

Fredy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindado su gran apoyo ello, podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y comprar llantas nuevas, con lo cual tendrá un vehículo más seguro y podrá trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y podrá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Fredy is 30 years old and lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having a warm and pleasant climate. This area is known for agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, and other crops. Fredy is a hardworking gentleman who studied to become a mechanic, but he was not able to find a job. He decided to work as a motorcycle taxi driver and used the money he saved up over time to buy his own vehicle.

Fredy works with great enthusiasm day after day. He works at his business approximately 10 hours each day is able to serve up to 30 customers. Fredy believes he is doing well in his business because he drives in a responsible manner and treats his customers in a friendly manner.

Fredy is grateful to the Kiva lenders and this is the second time he has received support from them. He will be able to provide general maintenance for his vehicle and buy new tires. As a result, his vehicle will be safer and he will be able to work with greater peace of mind. Fredy will continue working so that he can fulfill his greatest wish of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 63 years old and lives in Bagakay, Ozamis City. She is a widow with eight adult children. Carmencita has a rolling (mobile) food stall. She has had this business for four years.

Carmencita has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to provide capital to purchase ingredients for her food stall such as spices, soy sauce, vegetable oil, meat and seasoning. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Carmencita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices, soy sauce, vegetable oil, meat and seasoning.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl, aged 19, is the loving mother of one child. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent. Sheryl will add these to her store as her customers are always looking for these goods. She hopes that her business will be successful so that she can save and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent

loans.name: Efrelyn

texts.en:
Efrelyn is from the village of Villaluz. She is 28 years old and is married. To make a living, Efrelyn owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to members of the local community. Efrelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. 

Efrelyn decided to borrow money to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a motorcycle used in the business.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy carismática, luchadora y con ganas de seguir adelante. Está casada con Marcos, quien es empleado, tiene dos hijos pero ya son adultos e independientes. Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus padres, quienes son de edad avanzada.

Ella se dedica a la venta de libros, para esto cuenta acondicionó un espacio en su vivienda, de esta manera ahorra en gastos de alquiler. Su mercadería la obtiene comprando semanalmente de la ciudad principal que queda a 35 Km. de su pueblo. Atiende todos los días, desde muy temprano, con la ayuda de su esposo. Inició este negocio hace 5 años, tiempo en el cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y solicita en la localidad donde vive. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que su labor es reconocida en la zona ya que algunas veces participa en eventos como ferias o premiaciones de lectura organizadas por instituciones educativas. Además su actividad le genera los ingresos económicos que le da la tranquilidad para enfrentar los gastos que se le presentan durante el día. Comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de desempeñar un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con la institución MFP. Siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona responsable y está feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder realizar una buena inversión. Además está segura de que seguirá cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo, como lo hizo hasta ahora, y está muy comprometida con el grupo al que pertenece y no desea dejar una mala impresión, ni a ellos ni a la institución.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará útiles escolares, como cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores crayolas y juegos didácticos, para aumentar el stock de su tienda. Su inversión en cada compra supera los 500 soles.
texts.en:
Emerita is 53 years old. She is a very charismatic woman, hard-working and with the will to continue forward. She is married to Marcos, who is employed. She has two children, but they are already adults and independent. She now lives with her husband and her parents, who are of advanced age.

Her business is selling books, for which she has arranged a space in her home. In this way she saves on the costs of renting. She obtains her merchandise by buying weekly in the principal city, which is 35 km from her town. She tends the store every day, from very early hours, with the help of her husband. She began this business 5 years ago, and in this time she has become very well known and sought after in the district where she lives. What she likes about her job is that her work is recognized in the area, since she sometimes participates in events such as fairs or reading awards organized by educational institutions. In addition, her business generates income that gives her the tranquility to face the expenses that are presented to her during the day. She comments that she chose this business out of the need to have a job and feel like a productive woman. Therefore, she has a great will to continue growing in her work and expand her business.

This is her 9th loan with the MFP institution. She has always been characterized within her group as a responsible person, and she is happy for the opportunity that they offer her to make a good investment. In addition, she is sure that she will continue making her loan payments on time, as she has done up to now, and she is very committed to the group she belongs to and doesn't want to make a bad impression, either with them or with the institution.

With the amount she has applied for, 1000 PEN, she will buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, crayons, and learning games to increase the stock in her store. Her investment with each purchase will exceed 500 PEN.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, crayons, and learning games to increase the stock in her store

loans.name: Emmelie

texts.en:
Emmelie is married with five children. She is 34 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Emmelie buy and sells sacks to earn a living and has had this business for six months. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more sacks to sell/retail.

Emmelie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Emmelie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks to sell/retail

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamis City. She is married with one child of school-going age. Leonila has had a store that sells a variety of products for the past 10 years.

Leonila has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as  rice, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, snack foods, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leonila hopes to save money in case of emergencies and that she can expand her little business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en: Edmund is 45 years old and is engaged in a pig-fattening business. In operating this business, he often experiences a lack of feed which is not good for the health of his pigs. This has caused him to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy pig feed and vitamins. He wants his pigs to be healthy and well-nourished so that he can sell them at a profitable price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabena  est conseillère et doyenne du groupe « Fidélité », âgée d'environ 33 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants. Son mari est décédé depuis 2006 suite à une maladie subite. Tous ses enfants étudient. Elle commença son business avec son fond propre, alors reçu par son défunt époux. Elle vend des poissons frais Tompson. Elle fait le porte à porte pour intéresser les clients consommateurs (ménages, restaurant, etc.). Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF Hekima vers les années 2007 pour un soutien additionnel. Avant cette activité de vente poissons, elle vendait des souliers usagers. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner de 3 cartons de poissons Tompson en provenance de Kinshasa. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Kabena is the advisor and dean of the Fidélité group. She is about 33 years old, a widow and mother of 5 children. Her husband died in 2006 due to a sudden illness. All of Kabena's children attend school.

Kabena began her business with her own funds, which she received from her late husband. She sells fresh Thompson's fish by going door to door to market to consumer customers (households, restaurants, etc.) 

She began borrowing from the microfinance institution Hekima around 2007 for some additional financial support. Before she began selling fish, Kabena sold used shoes. This new loan will allow her to stock up on 3 packages of Thompson's fish from Kinshasa. Kabena thanks Hekima for their support of poor women who are not otherwise eligible for traditional banking.

loans.use: to purchase 3 packages of Thompson's fish

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 57 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Liza has been a farmer for the past three years.

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production. Liza has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes that PMPC can help to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is 40 years old and is married with two adult daughters and a son. She lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, Ma. Nancy has sold bananas to earn a living. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly and has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Ma. Nancy is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living condition with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 43 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS. She is married with three children. Vivian has had a general store for the past seven years.

She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as sugar, salt, oil and beverages. Vivian has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to have a large business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sugar, salt, oil and beverages

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, aged 31, is married and lives with his three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been selling coconuts for more than five years, earning approximately US$8 per day. His wife is a construction worker who earns about US$4 each day.

In order to improve his family’s finances, Chea is requesting a loan of US$500 to raise capital in his business so he can purchase more coconuts to sell. This money will help him to expand his business and earn more income for his family. In the future, he would like to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for transporting the coconuts he sells. In addition, he hopes to build a fence around his house and to send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita is the leader of a five-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

Teresita is married and has four children. She is 46 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has had a manicure and pedicure business for the past 10 years. 

Teresita has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase cement, lumber, sand and gravel for house repairs. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el Grupo Jóvenes Emprendedores.

Maria, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de verduras. Antes tenía un puesto en un mercado pero como no ganaba mucho, cuando unas amigas la invitaran a trabajar de otra manera, se animó inmediatamente. Ahora compra verduras directamente de las chacras por cantidades y las vende en varios mercados.

Su préstamo lo va a usar para comprar verduras y tubérculos en mayores cantidades, para así poder obtener mejores precios y atender a más clientes de diferentes mercados.

Maria tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos. Dos de ellos ya son mayores así que vive solo con su pareja y su niño más pequeño que tiene 14 años. Su mayor sueño es tener una bodega en su casa y espera poder lograrlo a la brevedad pues ya tiene un espacio para eso.

Maria está muy agradecida por el préstamo y contenta por saber que mucha gente desinteresada la ayuda en su progreso.

En la foto, Maria es la señora en la derecha, vestida en negro. Las niñas son hijas de otras socias, que han acompañado sus madres al desembolso.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This is the group known as “Jóvenes Emprendedores” (Young Entrepreneurs).

Maria is one of the members. She earns her living by selling vegetables. Maria previously had a stand at the market, but she was not able to earn much. One of her friends convinced her to try another method of working, so she was immediately excited about trying it. Now she buys vegetables directly from the fields in bulk and then sells them at different markets.

Her loan will be used to buy vegetables and tubers in large quantities so that she can get a better price. As a result, she will be able to serve more customers at the various markets.

Maria is 45 years old and has three children. Her greatest wish is to have a store in her house. She hopes to accomplish this very soon since she already has adequate space. Maria is grateful for this loan and is pleased that many people are interested in helping her make progress.

In the photo, Maria is the woman seated on the right wearing a black track suit. The girls in the photo are the daughters of some of the other members since they were present with their mothers at the time of the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and tubers in large quantities.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia, who runs a sari-sari store business, is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to use in the purchase of biscuits, snacks, breads and spices to stock her store. She just hopes that these goods will produce a higher income. With her tireless promoting of their lives, she is looking forward to the improvement of her income with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, snacks, breads and spices

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 40 years old and lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City. She is a widow with six adult children. Lily requested a loan to buy materials for her house that needs repair such as lumber, nails and galvanized iron, and to pay for the labor. She has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase these materials.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lily hopes to have a better and presentable house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house such as lumber, nails and galvanized iron and to pay for the labor.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Shirimanimbere Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe Shirimanimbere et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 38 ans et est mariée, Siméon, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants, âgés de  3 mois  à  13 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le métier de  tailleur depuis  4ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle acheter beaucoup de  matériels (fil, pagnes,…)à l'aide desquels ,elle offre le service de couture à ses clients. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Chantal is a member of the Shirimanimbere group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 38 years old and married to Siméon, a tailor.  Chantal and Siméon have seven children, ranging from the ages of three months to 13 years.

Chantal has been working as a tailor for the past four years.

This is her first loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will be buying large quantities of various materials such as threads and "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) in order to offer sewing services to her customers.

In the coming years, she would like to ensure that her children go to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of various materials such as threads and "pagnes", in order to offer sewing services to her customers.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is from the village of Olingan. She is 64 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Her existing business is food vending at the school from which she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Daylinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed for her food vending. This will be Daylinda's ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed for her food vending.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with four adult daughters. She is 60 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Lolita sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from doing this type of work. 

Lolita has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to to buy more bananas for her buy-and-sell banana business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from the village of Villaluz. She is 60 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Rosalina operates a motorcycle transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with one child. She is 38 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Jocelyn sells rice and corn to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 8000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to buy more rice and corn to resell.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve living conditions by using the profits of the rice and corn resale business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and corn to resell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from the village of Union. She is 37 years old, is married and has four children. Lilibeth owns and operates a direct selling business which sells clothing, lotions, cologne and shoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for six years. 

Lilibeth is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as shoes, lotions and clothing to expand her product offering.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, lotions and clothing to expand her product offering

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Susan sells copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10000 PHP to buy more buko of coconut to make it copra for her copra business.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the copra business.

loans.use: to buy more buko of coconut for making copra.

loans.name: Reymaver

texts.en: Reymaver is a 34-year-old married woman with two school-age children. She has been operating a store in her community for more than two years. She earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her store. She is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional products. Reymaver hopes that her business will expand to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices and condiments for her store

loans.name: Faidi

texts.en:
Faidi is a resident of Malindi of Coast province, Kenya. She has three children who all attend school. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for two years. Separately, she gets her salary from being a room attendant.
She learnt about Milango through an employee with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is low income during low season.
Faidi is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and source pans for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family. She aspires to open a big restaurant in future.

loans.use: To buy some flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and source pans for the cafe.

loans.name: Atsou

texts.fr: Atsou âgé de 43ans est marié à une couturière. Ils ont un enfant de 01 an. Il est revendeur de gaz en bouteille dans une boutique. Pour éviter la pénurie au niveau de la marchandise, il sollicite un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner  en marchandises. Il veut agrandir son actif, conquérir d’autres marchés et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Atsou, age 43, is married to a seamstress with whom he has a one-year-old child.  He works as a reseller of gas cylinders, in a shop.

To prevent a shortage of merchandise, he is requesting a first loan to buy some gas cylinders.

He wants to expand his activity, win other markets and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy empty gas cylinders.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has five children, three of whom attend school. He owns a transport business, a business that he has been operating for three years.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the seasonal market.

Alan is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase more bicycles. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His dream is to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase more bicycles.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael has witnessed a great improvement in her business. She was able to repay her loan in time and is now asking for a loan of 85,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more food stock and to pay for her children's school fees. She believes the returns will enable her to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like sugar and flour and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Telfilo

texts.en: Telfilo is 38 years old, happily married and blessed with two children. The main source of income for Telfilo’s family comes primarily from his retail store. He has been in this kind of business for almost five years. The results of his labor make him really thankful to Almighty God who has given him the strength to face all the challenges in his life. Telfilo would like to buy stock of groceries such as soft drinks, breads, assorted biscuits, ingredients, canned goods, shampoo, detergents, soap and other basic necessities. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. He believes that through this loan, he can expand his business and make it more profitable, which will enable him to provide customer satisfaction.
