Algunas veces lleva sus productos a otras ciudades para venderlos en los mercados o cuando tiene pedidos de clientes específicos y retorna a su pueblo después de una semana. Se dedica a este trabajo cerca de 25 años, pero en su local lleva 15 años, tiempo en el cual a llegado a ser muy conocida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da buenos ingresos económicos para solventar la economía de su casa; lo que no le gusta es que en ocasiones le falta dinero para invertir cuando se presenta una oportunidad de una buena compra. A pesar de ello tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y desea ampliar su negocio.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, como lo hizo en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas muy responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará diversos tipos de granos, por sacos, como arroz, maíz y frijol, e invertirá también en la compra de un lote de 10 racimos de plátano.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to better herself.  She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two adult daughters.  They share the same desire to get ahead.

She sells regional produce for a living.  Her main product is corn, in grains or milled, though she also sells rice, bananas, or domestic animals.  She has a shop set up in her home.  Sometimes she takes her produce to other cities to sell it in markets or when she has orders from specific customers and then she returns to her town in a week.  She has been doing this work for around 25 years, but she has been in her current location for 15 years, during which time she has become very well-known.  What she likes about her work is that it is profitable; it provides her with good income so she can cover her household expenses.  What she does not like is that sometimes she does not have enough money to invest when a good buying opportunity comes up.  Despite that, she is very motivated to keep working and she wants to expand her business.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as this makes her feel secure in moving ahead with her business.  She also promises to once again make her payments on time, as she did with her previous loan.  She likes being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. 

She will use the amount requested, 1,500 nuevos soles, to buy different kinds of grains by the sack, such as rice, corn, and beans, and she will also buy a batch of 10 bunches of bananas.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of grains by the sack, such as rice, corn, and beans, and to buy a batch of 10 bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en:
Saraphina is 59 years old and married, with seven children.  To earn a living, she does mixed farming. She rears dairy cows and grows food crops.  She has earned a living from farming for over 20 years.  She employs one person to assist her in her farm.

Saraphina has requested 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbage seedlings.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned about business record-keeping and financial management. This has helped her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cabbage seedlings.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón tiene 37 años, es un hombre luchador, carismático y muy trabajador. Su pareja es Zoila, quien es ama de casa. Vive con su pareja ya varios años y fruto de esa unión tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años, a quien ama muchísimo y es por quien se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante.
Hace 7 años compró su primer motocarro, desde entonces se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, todo este tiempo le ha servido para generar sus propios recursos económicos y además le ha permitido que los habitantes de la localidad en la que vive lo reconozcan como un buen conductor, ya que siempre brinda seguridad durante su recorrido. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, no tiene un horario de trabajo estricto que cumplir, y obtiene su propio dinero con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar. Pero principalmente le permite pasar momentos agradables al lado de su hijo en sus ratos libres; la única dificultad que encuentra son las continuas lluvias que se presentan en ésta época, lo que produce que las calles sin asfalto retracen su trabajo y deterioren algunas piezas de su vehículo. Aun así tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando hasta establecer una tienda de repuestos de motocarro.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó por ser una persona muy puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Y está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le están brindando para multiplicar su inversión.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará un motor nuevo que cuesta 800 soles. También cambiará el toldo y el tapizado que necesita su motocarro para que funcione en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Napoleon, 37, is a hardworking, charismatic man who fights for what he needs.  His partner is Zoila, who is a housewife.  He has lived with her for some years and they have a 6-year old son who they love very much and that is why every day he makes a big effort  to get ahead.

7 years ago he bought his first motorcar and since then he has transported passengers and this has generated his own income.  He is considered a good driver by the people of the area since he drives safely.  What he likes about his work is the independence.  He doesn’t have a fixed schedule that he has to adhere to and he makes his own money that he uses to support his household.  But principally he likes to spend happy times with his son when he can.  The only difficulty that he has found is the continual rains that come during this season. The unpaved streets slow his work and deteriorate some parts of his vehicle. But he still wants to continue working and set up a store for motorcar parts.

This is his 7th loan with MFP.  He is known as a very punctual and responsible person with his payments.  Napoleon is very grateful for the support that he has received in multiplying his investment.

He will use the 1500 new sols to buy a new motor that costs 800 sols.  He would also change the awning and the floor mats that his motorcar needs to function in top condition.

loans.use: to buy a new motor that costs 800 sols and to change the awning and the floormats that his motorcar needs to function in optimal shape.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
“Surtiré mi negocio con radios y  juguetes principalmente muñecas y ametralladoras” menciono Gloria de los Ángeles. Ella inicio hace 6 años vendiendo ropa y cosméticos con los créditos a logrado diversificar su negocio y ampliarlo. 
Su meta es tener una miscelánea.
texts.en: María de los Ángeles stated that she will stock her business with radios and toys, especially dolls and machine guns.  She started off six years ago selling clothes and cosmetics and with the loans she’s gotten she’s managed to diversify and expand her business.  Her goal is to have a variety store.

loans.use: to buy radios and toys, especially dolls and machine guns.

loans.name: Olga Dorila

texts.es: Olga de 35 años de edad, casada, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la agricultura donde siembra hortalizas, culantro, maíz y frijoles. Ella estuvo trabajando en un grupo comunitario y de allí le quedo su parcela para hacer sus propios cultivos. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Ya ha trabajado con varios prestamos con ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es el quinto préstamo, que es por 25,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para los cultivos y para pagar el por mantenimiento del mismo. Esta inversión le ayudara a sacar mejores cosechas y a ampliar sus cultivos. Su meta es ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga, 35, is married and lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her husband and two children.  She’s been working in agriculture 12 years growing vegetables, coriander, corn and beans.  She worked with a community group and that’s how she got her parcel of land to grow her own crops.  She sells her production in the local market.  

She’s worked with several ODEF loans and the one she’s requesting now is her fifth.  It’s for 25,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy fertilizer for the crops and to pay labor costs to care for them.  This investment will help her produce better harvests and to expand her crops.  Her goal is to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Walkiria

texts.es:
Walkiria es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Masaya. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa negocio que inicio hace 10 años. 
Este es un crédito temporada el cual  utilizara para aprovechar la temporada.
texts.en:
Walkiria is a hard-working and enterprising woman from Masaya.  She started her business of selling clothes ten years ago.

This is a seasonal loan, which she will use to take advantage of the season.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Orsa

texts.es:
Orsa tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre, entusiasta y emprendedora. Su pareja es Alfonso, quien es comerciante, con él tiene cinco hijos. Viven en la casa que compró con la ayuda de su cónyuge y donde luchan continuamente para salir adelante.
Su trabajo es la crianza de pollos, esta labor la realiza en su propio terreno, donde tiene instalado un galpón con una capacidad de hasta 300 pollos. Considera que es una actividad que requiere de mucha paciencia y de gran disposición para su ejecución. Cuando se ha cumplido el tiempo preciso para la venta y las aves han alcanzado su peso ideal, las traslada en jaulas especiales hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, tiempo necesario que le ha servido para acoplarse al ritmo de trabajo y aprender técnicas de venta que le ayudan a ganar más. Tiene la ayuda total de sus hijos mayores y de su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la rentabilidad que obtiene por sus ventas, lo cual le permite pagar los gastos diarios en su casa. Lo que no le gusta es que los alimentos balanceados de los pollos son inconstantes y se incrementan de un momento a otro haciendo que su inversión aumente, pero  esto no la desanima de seguir trabajando.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal, donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria. Agradece que le brinden este préstamo que será un respaldo para seguir implementando su negocio.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, comprará más pollos pequeños para iniciar su nueva campaña de crianza. También renovará algunos bebederos y comprará alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Orsa is 43 years old.  She is a happy, enthusiastic, and enterprising woman.  Her partner, Alfonso, is a storekeeper and together they have five children.  They live in the house she bought with the help of her partner and where they continually strive to get ahead.

She works raising chickens, which she does on her own land where she has set up a shed that can hold up to 300 chickens.  She believes that her work requires a lot of patience and a real aptitude.  When the right amount of time has passed and the birds have reached their ideal weight, she takes them in special cages to the city's market to sell.  She has been doing this work for four years, which was time she needed and that has allowed her to fall into the rhythm of her work and to learn the selling techniques that allow her to earn more.  She has the complete help of her older children and her partner.  What she likes about her work are the profits she receives from her sales, which allow her to cover her daily household expenses.  What she does not like is that the price of chicken feed is not stable and from one minute to the next it can go up, which means she has to spend more.  Nevertheless, this does not deter her from her work.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has always been a very good member of her communal bank, where she is well-liked for being very responsible and supportive.  She is thankful for being offered this loan, as it will support her in continuing with her business.  

With the requested loan of 3,000 nuevos soles she will buy more small chickens to start a new round of growing.  She will also renovate some watering areas and buy feed.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens to start a new round of growing, to renovate some watering areas, and to buy feed

loans.name: Nadir Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NADIR” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soraya es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de polleras y mantas, pastelería, venta de cosméticos, productos de belleza, venta de ropa usada, venta de joyas y material de plata.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soraya es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa, ella nos cuenta que hace varios años emprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia y con ayuda de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ciudades de Potosi y Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el personal.
texts.en:
The Nadir communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has seven members led by a governing board headed by Soraya, the president.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: clothing sales, skirt and blanket sales, pastry making, cosmetics sales, beauty products sales, used clothes sales, sale of silver jewelry and other silver items.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Soraya.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago having been invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling clothes and she relates that she started the business several years ago on her own initiative and with her mother’s help.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy clothes from wholesalers and then resell it in the cities of Potosí and Oruro.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the staff.

loans.use: to buy clothes.
